momPost.overlayTitle: THINGS I DO AT NIGHT INSTEAD OF SLEEPING
momPost.hook: Stare at the baby monitor. Check if they're breathing. Check again. Wonder if I'll ever sleep normally again.
momPost.imagePrompt: Soft, minimalist vector illustration showing a phone screen glowing in darkness, surrounded by floating thought bubbles containing simple icons: baby monitor, clock showing 3am, social media scroll, online shopping cart. Muted navy and lavender color palette.
momPost.caption:

â€¢ Scroll through 372 photos of baby from today
â€¢ Plan tomorrow's schedule I won't follow
â€¢ Wonder if I'm doing any of this right
â€¢ Panic-buy baby items at 3am

â†’ Dear mama, this midnight spiral? It's not just you. Your 3am worries don't make you a bad mom - they make you a mom who cares deeply. That racing mind is carrying so much love and responsibility.

Take a slow breath with me. Just one. Your baby is sleeping. You're doing better than you think. ðŸ’œ

momPost.basePrompt: night time spirals after baby sleeps
momPost.overlaySubtitle: When Everyone Else Is Sleeping ðŸŒ‘
momPost.hook: The house is quiet but my mind won't stop replaying every tiny moment, every what-if from today.
momPost.imagePrompt: Abstract, peaceful vector design with a large moon phase diagram in soft whites and teals, surrounded by gentle swirling thought bubbles and stars. Calming nighttime palette with deep blues and silver accents.
momPost.caption:
Tonight's mental tabs open:
â€¢ Did I stimulate baby enough today?
â€¢ Should I wake them to feed?
â€¢ What if they get sick?
â€¢ Am I bonding enough?
â€¢ Will I ever feel like myself again?
â€¢ *checks 14 developmental milestone lists*

Sweet mama, your love for your baby is so big it keeps you awake. But these spinning thoughts? They're part of learning to be a mom, not signs you're failing at it.

Instead of fighting the night spiral, let's breathe together. Your baby is safe. Tomorrow is a new day. And you're exactly the mom your little one needs. âœ¨
momPost.cta: Download MomMirror for a gentle companion during those quiet night hours.
momPost.safetyFooter: If anxiety is keeping you awake most nights, it's okay to reach out to your healthcare provider. You deserve support. ðŸ’—
